edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model.formats

Interface Formatter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFormatter, JsonLdFormatter, NquadsFormatter, RdfXmlFormatter, SimpleFormatter, TurtleFormatter

    public interface Formatter
    Formatters are used to implement a new format in this application. They provide the following features:
    • Parse incoming HTTP Accept Headers additional Format info
    • Format String representations of the format applying the additional info
    • Get HTTP ContentType Header values to use in HTTP Responses
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String format(FormattableObject obj)
      Formats a given FormattableObject with this formatter
      java.lang.String getContentType()
      Return a String representation of this formatter that can be used in the HTTP Responses as ContentType Header
      Format getFormat()
      Return the Format implemented by this Formatter
      java.lang.String getFormatString()
      Return the Format-String used to recognize this Format in HTTP Accept Headers This includes only the part denoting the media type, but not additional information provided.
      boolean isValid()
      Returns whether this formatter is valid.
      void setAcceptPart(java.lang.String acceptPart, FormattableObject.Type type)
      Updates this formatter with additional information provided by the HTTP Accept header.

    • Method Detail

      • getFormat

        Format getFormat()
        Return the Format implemented by this Formatter
        Returns:
        The format

      • getFormatString

        java.lang.String getFormatString()
        Return the Format-String used to recognize this Format in HTTP Accept Headers

        This includes only the part denoting the media type, but not additional information provided.

        Returns:
        The formatString

      • format

        java.lang.String format(FormattableObject obj)
        Formats a given FormattableObject with this formatter
        Parameters:
        obj - The Object for format
        Returns:
        The String representation of the given FormattableObject

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Returns whether this formatter is valid. This means that setAcceptPart(String, Type) was called with a valid HTTP Accept Header part. Without calling this method before, the formatter is always invalid.
        Returns:
        Whether this formatter has been correctly initialized by setAcceptPart(String, Type)

      • setAcceptPart

        void setAcceptPart(java.lang.String acceptPart,
                   FormattableObject.Type type)
        Updates this formatter with additional information provided by the HTTP Accept header.

        This method must always be called, eventually with a null value, if the format does not need additional info, or this formatter cannot be used / is inValid

        Parameters:
        acceptPart - The part of the HTTP Accept Header with additional information
        type - The type of Object this formatter will be used with. May be null.

      • getContentType

        java.lang.String getContentType()
        Return a String representation of this formatter that can be used in the HTTP Responses as ContentType Header
        Returns:
        String representation for ContentType HTTP Header
